Map Files¶

Although index maps and other raster maps are both GRASS ASCII maps, a special table was created for index maps for easier implementation.

Index Map File Object¶

File extension: idx

class gsshapy.orm.IndexMap(name=None)¶
tableName = 'idx_index_maps'¶

Database tablename

id¶

PK

mapTableFileID¶

FK

north¶

FLOAT

south¶

FLOAT

east¶

FLOAT

west¶

FLOAT

rows¶

INTEGER

columns¶

INTEGER

srid¶

SRID

filename¶

STRING

rasterText¶

STRING

raster¶

RASTER

fileExtension¶

STRING

mapTableFile¶

RELATIONSHIP

mapTables¶

RELATIONSHIP

indices¶

RELATIONSHIP

contaminants¶

RELATIONSHIP

name¶

STRING

getAsGrassAsciiGrid(session)¶

Get the raster in the Grass Ascii Grid format

getAsKmlClusters(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, noDataValue=None)¶

Get the raster in a clustered KML format

getAsKmlGrid(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, noDataValue=None)¶

Get the raster in KML format

getAsKmlPng(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, drawOrder=0, noDataValue=None, cellSize=None, resampleMethod='NearestNeighbour')¶

Get the raster in a PNG / KML format

read(directory, filename, session, spatial=False, spatialReferenceID=4236, raster2pgsqlPath='raster2pgsql')¶

Read file into the database.

write(directory, name=None, session=None)¶

Index Map Write to File Method

Raster Map File Object¶

File extensions: Variable (e.g.: ele, msk, aqe)

class gsshapy.orm.RasterMapFile¶
tableName = 'raster_maps'¶

Database tablename

id¶

PK

projectFileID¶

FK

north¶

FLOAT

south¶

FLOAT

east¶

FLOAT

FLOAT

INTEGER

INTEGER

STRING

STRING

raster¶

RASTER

STRING

projectFile¶

RELATIONSHIP

getAsGrassAsciiGrid(session)¶

Get the raster in the Grass Ascii Grid format

getAsKmlClusters(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, noDataValue=None)¶

Get the raster in a clustered KML format

getAsKmlGrid(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, noDataValue=None)¶

Get the raster in KML format

getAsKmlPng(session, path=None, colorRamp=0, documentName=None, alpha=1.0, drawOrder=0, noDataValue=None, cellSize=None, resampleMethod='NearestNeighbour')¶

Get the raster in a PNG / KML format

read(directory, filename, session, spatial=False, spatialReferenceID=4236, raster2pgsqlPath='raster2pgsql')¶

Read file into the database.

write(session, directory, name)¶

Write from database to file.

session = SQLAlchemy session object

directory = to which directory will the files be written (e.g.: ‘/example/path’)

name = name of file that will be written (e.g.: ‘my_project.ext’)
